Okay, from the top: bombs can pack a punch, in the right situation. In a 
stationary hand-to-hand fight they will only harm you. Cloak is good for 
placing bombs and gas in the midst of a crowded room, grabbing keys, etc. In 
one of those situations where all your enemies are standing still and the 
level is stalemated, Taunt can get people moving again. You can anchor a gas 
cloud by placing one edge on a wall. Make a bunch of these in a bottleneck 
or gateway, and taunt. You'll see the difference. A high-level elf has some 
nasty stones. I mean, NASTY stones. As in one hit can kill you. And they're 
hard to target when they hide in the woods. And if you take the time to find 
a spot you can bounce rocks off of and keep them going perpetually, you have 
another nice taunt-trap. Orcs... yeah, howl sucks. Eating bodies is 
interesting, as you can heal without a cleric... but hey, howl sucks. I've 
never, in fact, seen it do anything noticeable. Orc Captain, as we were 
discussing a few days ago, is also crappy. I did a little test a while back 
in which I made a whole bunch of little rooms and placed an orc and orc 
captain in each and made them fight. At lower levels, the orc captains 
usually won (probably because of their fighting range), and at levels >5 the 
orcs usually won (perhaps because of a more efficient Howl). Just a little 
bit of info for you. Barbarians can do some real damage, but their lack of 
versatility makes them hard to play. The boulders, of course, are coming out 
of the ground. Would you prefer projectile vomit? Skeletons aren't strong 
enough to make a team work, and at higher levels you can make as many as you 
want with a cleric. Same with ghosts. They're really nice for exploring and 
picking up hard-to-reach gold, but for that stuff you don't need a level 14. 
Scaring by itself will never defeat anything, so if you use ghosts you'd 
better have some soldiers hanging around.
Fairies are annoying to use. They don't really freeze anything long enough 
to kill it, and they die all over the place. They're good for doing 
scout-work, but not as good as ghosts. Druids can whip them up in a flash, 
and at low levels, so why hire them? Druids themselves are a bit on the weak 
side, and I don't see their powerful ranged attack making up for it. And the 
trees... well, they suck, unless your enemy is too stupid to cut them down. 
Slimes are neatly impossible to play, as they keep losing levels, and are 
slow as anything. Going through the game as a slime is perhaps the ultimate 
challenge (poke). Fire elementals lose their effectiveness after a while, so 
you're better off just having an archie summon them.
